tool.name: obiannotate
tool.command:
obiannotate ${seqrank}
#if $rename_tag.old_name and $rename_tag.new_name -R '$rename_tag.old_name':'$rename_tag.new_name' #end if
#if $deletetag_key --delete-tag='$deletetag_key' #end if
#if $set_tag.key and $set_tag.pythonexpression -S '$set_tag.key':'$set_tag.pythonexpression' #end if
#if $taglist --tag-list='$taglist' #end if
#if $setid_pythonexpression --set-identifier='$setid_pythonexpression' #end if
#if $pythonexpression --run='$pythonexpression' #end if
#if $setsequence_pythonexpression --set-sequence='$setsequence_pythonexpression' #end if
#if $setdefinition_pythonexpression --set-definition='$setdefinition_pythonexpression' #end if
#if $key_selector.key --keep='$key_selector.key' #end if #if $key_selector.key2 --keep='$key_selector.key2' #end if #if $key_selector.key3 --keep='$key_selector.key3' #end if #if $key_selector.key4 --keep='$key_selector.key4' #end if #if $key_selector.key5 --keep='$key_selector.key5' #end if
${length} ${clearbool} ${uniqid}
#if $rankname --with-taxon-at-rank='$rankname' #end if
#if $mclfile --mcl='$mclfile' #end if
'$inputseq' > '$output'

param.name: seqrank
param.label: Add a new attribute seq_rank
param.help: Use this option if you want to add a new attribute named seq_rank to the sequence record indicating its entry number in the sequence file

param.name: deletetag_key
param.label: Delete attribute
param.help: Use this option if you want to delete attribute named ATTRIBUTE_NAME.When this attribute is missing, the sequence record is skipped and the next one is examined

param.name: taglist
param.label: Use a tag list
param.help: file containing identifiers of sequences to select

param.name: setid_pythonexpression
param.label: Set sequence record identifier with a value
param.help: Use this option if you want to set sequence record identifier with a value computed from PYTHON_EXPRESSION

param.name: pythonexpression
param.label: Run a PYTHON_EXPRESSION on each selected sequence
param.help: Use this option if you want to run a PYTHON_EXPRESSION on each selected sequence

param.name: setsequence_pythonexpression
param.label: Change the sequence itself with a value
param.help: Use this option if you want to change the sequence itself with a value computed from PYTHON_EXPRESSION

param.name: setdefinition_pythonexpression
param.label: Set sequence definition with a value computed
param.help: Use this option if you want to set sequence definition with a value computed from PYTHON_EXPRESSION

param.name: clearbool
param.label: Clear all attributes associated to the sequence records
param.help: Use this option if you want to clear all attributes associated to the sequence records

param.name: key2
param.label: if you want to specify a second key

param.name: key3
param.label: if you want to specify a third key

param.name: key4
param.label: if you want to specify a fourth key

param.name: key5
param.label: if you want to specify a fifth key

param.name: length
param.label: Use the length option?
param.help: Use this option if you want to add attribute with seq_length as a key and sequence length as a value

param.name: rankname
param.label: Add taxonomic annotation
param.help: Use this option if you want to add taxonomic annotation at taxonomic rank RANK_NAME

param.name: mclfile
param.label: mcl file
param.help: use this option if you want to add a new attribute containing the number of the cluster the sequence record was assigned to, as indicated in file MCLFILE

param.name: uniqid
param.label: Force sequence record ids to be unique
param.help: Use this option if you want to force sequence record ids to be unique

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
`obiannotate` is the command that allows adding/modifying/removing annotation attributes attached to sequence records.
Once such attributes are added, they can be used by the other OBITools commands for filtering purposes or for statistics computing.
@OBITOOLS_LINK@
